channel.title: INtech
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtech, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Anthropic adds Allianz to growing list of enterprise wins
item.description: Anthropic announces its first enterprise deal of 2026 which includes building agents and for, and giving Claude code, to Allianz.

item.title: ‘Physical AI’ Is Coming for Your Car
item.description: What the latest tech-marketing buzzword has to say about the future of automotive.

item.title: Burtran Nano-Oxy Smart Air Purifier: Safe Sleep?
item.description: This negative-oxygen-ion-generating purifier claims to create a “forestlike atmosphere” in your bedroom.

item.title: Conservative Lawmakers Want Porn Taxes. Critics Say They’re Unconstitutional
item.description: Alabama passed a 10 percent porn tax last year, as Utah and Pennsylvania eye similar bills. Half the country has enacted age-verification laws to prev...

item.title: CES 2026: Everything revealed, from Nvidia’s debuts to AMD’s new chips to Razer’s AI oddities
item.description: CES 2026 is in full swing in Las Vegas, with the show floor open to the public after a packed couple of days occupied by press conferences from the li...

item.title: X restricts Grok’s image generation to paying subscribers only after drawing the world’s ire
item.description: Elon Musk's AI company has restricted Grok's controversial AI image-generation feature to only paying subscribers on X, after the tool invited heated ...

item.title: The venture firm that ate Silicon Valley just raised another $15 billion
item.description: In a blog post published Friday morning, Ben Horowitz writes that "as the American leader in Venture Capital, the fate of new technology in the United...

item.title: X Didn't Fix Grok's ‘Undressing’ Problem. It Just Makes People Pay for It
item.description: X is only allowing “verified” users to create images with Grok. Experts say it represents the “monetization of abuse”—and anyone can still generate im...

item.title: Crispr Pioneer Launches Startup to Make Tailored Gene-Editing Treatments
item.description: Aurora Therapeutics, cofounded by Nobel Prize–winning scientist Jennifer Doudna, plans to use gene editing and a new FDA regulatory pathway to commerc...

item.title: Data security startup Cyera hits $9B valuation six months after being valued at $6B
item.description: Cyera raised another $400 million just six months after its last huge round.
